law.catch_line: Within 5 days after the Mediation Service provides the tally of ballots for a consent election, a pa...

section.section:
Within 5 days after the Mediation Service provides the tally of ballots for a consent election, a party to the consent election may object to:
the conduct of the consent election; or
other conduct affecting the result of the consent election.
A party shall object in a timely manner, even if the number of challenged ballots is not sufficient to affect the result of the consent election.

text.section:
An objection under this section shall:
be in writing; and
state concisely each reason for the objection.

Each party who makes an objection shall:
submit to the Mediation Service:
4 copies of the objection; and
proof of service under item (2) of this subsection; and
serve immediately a copy of the objection on each other party.
The Mediation Service shall investigate each objection submitted in accordance with this section.
